Post.title: Git
Post._content:
# {% asset_img git-outline.png git %} [](http://naotu.baidu.com/file/5dcda8cf019f0f79dc6285c98298daf8?token=a65a47efab6ab2be) # - - > ## - **** {% asset_img version-control-1.png git %} > > > > RCS ## Centralized Version Control Systems CVCS - - {% asset_img version-control-2.png git %} ## - **** - {% asset_img version-control-3.png git %} # Git ## Git Git ## - - - - - Linux ## Git - Mac Xcode Command Line Tools Git (`xcode-select --install`) - Linux `sudo apt-get install git` - Windows [Git SCM](https://git-scm.com/) - Windows cmd git git.exe PATH Git Bash Git # - [SSH](https://coding.net/help/doc/git/ssh-key.html) ## ``` $ git config --global user.name "your_username" $ git config --global user.email your_email@domain.com ``` ## `git config` ``` # Git $VISUAL $EDITOR $ git config --global core.editor emacs # commit $ git config --global commit.template ~/.gitmessage.txt # 10 $ git config --global alias.last "log -10 --pretty=format:'%C(yellow)%h%Creset(%Cred%ad%Creset) - %Cgreen%aN%Creset : %s' --date=format:'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S' --graph" ``` Git * `.git/config` * `~/.gitconfig` `--global` * `$(prefix)/etc/gitconfig` `git config` > > [How do I make Git use the editor of my choice for commits?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2596805/how-do-i-make-git-use-the-editor-of-my-choice-for-commits) > [Git log pretty formats](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-log#_pretty_formats) # ```bash git clone ``` ``` # $ git clone /path/to/repository # SSH $ git clone git@git.hypers.com:Godfery/git-share-salloto.git # HTTPS $ git clone https:/path/to/repository.git ``` ```bash git clone -b master git@git.hypers.com:Godfery/git-share-salloto.git ``` ## HTTPS SSH > - HTTPSurlclonepush > - SSHcloneSSH KeySSH pushSSH key > > [Git Url HTTPS SSH ](http://wanderyt.github.io/2016/04/12/Git-Url-HTTPS-SSH-Difference/) # ``` git init # Git git init # Git git init --bare ``` {% asset_img git-init-bare.svg %} `git status` git > `-bare` `-bare` Git # `remote` ```bash # remote $ git remote -v # remote $ git remote remove origin # remote $ git remote add origin git@git.hypers.com:Godfery/git-share-salloto.git ``` # ## {% asset_img workflow.png git %} > git > `` > `Index` > `HEAD` ## {% asset_img workflow2.png %} | | | | --- | --- | | Repository | Git | | Branches | code line | | Tags | | | Commit | | | Revision | HEAD"HEAD~1"GitSHA1 hashid SHA1 id16016 | # ## `git add` ```bash # $ git add < filename > # $ git add . # $ git add -p ``` ## `git commit` ```bash $ git commit $ git commit -m "" # $ git commit -m "" --amend ``` # Git `.gitignore` ```bash # gitignore clone /.gitignore # gitignore ~/.gitignore_global # gitignore clone ( `core.excludesfile`) $GIT_DIR/info/exclude ``` ```bash # $ git update-index --assume-unchanged # $ git update-index --no-assume-unchanged # `assume-unchanged` $ git ls-files -v | grep '^h' ``` > > [git-ls-files](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-ls-files) # ## `git stash` ```bash # HEAD $ git stash # $ git stash apply # $ git stash list # list $ git stash pop # $ git stash clear ``` # ## `git status` ```bash $ git status ``` {% asset_img git-status-screenshots.png git %} - new file - modified - deleted - Untracked file ## `git log` ```bash # $ git log # $ git log --oneline #`` $ git log --author="" # `` `` $ git log --grep="" # `` `` ID`HEAD` $ git log .. # $ git log ``` ## `git checkout` ************ ```bash # `` `` $ git checkout # $ git checkout ``` # ## `git revert` `git reset` ```bash # $ git revert # $ git reset ``` {% asset_img git-revert.png git %} Git
revert bug `git revert` ### `git revert` ```bash # # $ git commit -m "" # $ git revert HEAD ``` {% asset_img git-revert-show1.png git %} {% asset_img git-revert-show2.png git %} ### `git reset` `git checkout` `git reset` __ ```bash # $ git reset # $ git reset # $ git reset --hard # `` $ git reset # `` $ git reset --hard ``` ### `git revert` `git reset` (revert) __ `git reset` __ **** `` `git reset` `git reset``git revert` ### `git reset` `hello.js` `main.js` - 1 ```bash # hello.jsmain.js # $ git add . # hello.jsmain.js # main.js $ git reset main.js # hello.js $ git commit -m "hello.js" # main.js $ git add main.js $ git commit -m " main.js" ``` - 2 ```bash # `foo.js` # $ git add foo.js $ git commit -m "" # `foo.js` # $ git commit -a -m "" # $ git reset --hard HEAD~2 ``` ## `git clean` `git clean` `rm` `git clean` `git reset --hard` `reset` ```bash # $ git clean -n # $ git clean -f # $ git clean -f # $ git clean -df ``` `git reset --hard` `git clean -f` ```bash # # # "" # $ git reset --hard # $ git clean -df ``` >`-f` `clean.requireForce` `false` `true` __ `.gitignore` # ## `git commit --amend` ```bash $ git commit --amend ``` {% asset_img git-commit-ammend1.png git %} {% asset_img git-commit-ammend2.png git %} > **** > ```bash # hello.js main.js $ git add hello.js $ git commit # main.js $ git add main.js $ git commit --amend --no-edit ``` `--no-edit` > `git commit --amend` amend ## `git rebase` ```bash # rebase `` $ git rebase ``` > ID `HEAD` rebase {% asset_img git-rebase-1.png git %} feature master merge rebase merge3-way merge rebase master {% asset_img git-rebase-2.png git %} {% asset_img git-rebase-3.png git %} rebase git merge rebase > ** rebase ** ### `git rebase -i` ```bash pick fc62e55 added:file_size pick 9824bf4 fixed:little thing pick 21d80a5 added:number to log pick 76b9da6 added:the apply command pick c264051 Revert:"added file_size" - not implemented correctly # Rebase f408319..b04dc3d onto f408319 # # Commands: # p, pick = use commit # r, reword = use commit, but edit the commit message # e, edit = use commit, but stop for amending # s, squash = use commit, but meld into previous commit # f, fixup = like "squash", but discard this commit's log message # x, exec = run command (the rest of the line) using shell # d, drop = remove commit # # If you remove a line here THAT COMMIT WILL BE LOST. # However, if you remove everything, the rebase will be aborted. # ``` 5 ```bash (action) (partial-sha) (short commit message) ``` - 'pick'gitcommit message - 'reword'gitcommit message - 'edit'git - 'squash'git - 'fixup' - 'exec' shell - 'drop' ```bash git rebase --continue ``` ## `git reflog` Git HEAD ```bash $ git reflog ``` {% asset_img git-reflog.png git %} ```bash $ git reset --hard 9d43f81 ``` `git reset`master **** # ## `git remote` ```bash # $ git remote # URL $ git remote -v # $ git remote add # $ git remote rm # $ git remote rename ``` > `git clone` origin ## `git fetch` ```bash # $ git fetch # $ git fetch ``` ```bash $ git fetch origin ``` {% asset_img git-fetch.png git %} ```bash # master origin/master $ git log --oneline master..origin/master # $ git merge origin/master ``` ```bash $ git pull # $ git fetch && git merge ``` ```bash # $ git pull # $ git fetch && git merge origin/. # `git rebase` `git merge` $ git pull --rebase ``` > `--rebase` merge commits rebase merge ## `git push` Push ```bash # `` $ git push # $ git push --force # $ git push --all # `--all` `--tags` $ git push --tags ``` ### ```bash # master $ git checkout master # fetch $ git fetch origin master # origin/master $ git rebase -i origin/master # Squash commits, fix up commit messages etc. $ git push origin master ``` > `master` `git push` ```bash # $ git branch # `` ____ $ git branch # Git $ git branch -d # $ git branch -D # `` $ git branch -m ``` # ## `git checkout` ```bash # `git branch` `` $ git checkout # `` ____ $ git checkout -b # `` $ git checkout -b ``` ## `git merge` Git fork `git merge` `git branch` ```bash git merge ``` {% asset_img git-merge.png git %} # Git cheat sheet [cheat sheet ](https://www.atlassian.com/dam/jcr:8132028b-024f-4b6b-953e-e68fcce0c5fa/atlassian-git-cheatsheet.pdf) # - [git book](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2) - [git-recipes BY geeeeeeeeek@github](https://github.com/geeeeeeeeek/git-recipes/wiki/) - [atlassian git tutorials](https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials) - [sparkbox/standard/style/git/.gitmessage](https://github.com/sparkbox/standard/blob/master/style/git/.gitmessage) - [12Git](http://www.infoq.com/cn/news/2016/01/12-git-advanced-commands) - [Why does GitHub recommend HTTPS over SSH?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11041729/why-does-github-recommend-https-over-ssh) - [Git Community Book ](http://gitbook.liuhui998.com/index.html) > [](https://github.com/hiyangguo)

Post.title: MVCMVVM
Post._content:
web webweb web web > - 19893: Tim Berners-Lee**** Information Management: A Proposal 199010Tim Berners-Lee NeXTStepGUI > - 19918: FTP > - 19925: Pei Wei Viola GUI X > - 19932: National Center for Supercomputing Applications **Mosaic** for X alpha > - 19934: > - 19945: > - 199410: World Wide Web Consortium W3C 1989391 webwebPPTwordwebHTMLHypertext Markup Language {% asset_img snipaste_20170730_122053.png snipaste_20170730_122053 %} ```html
The World Wide Web project

World Wide Web

The WorldWideWeb (W3) is a wide-area hypermedia information retrieval initiative aiming to give universal access to a large universe of documents.

Everything there is online about W3 is linked directly or indirectly to this document, including an executive summary of the project, Mailing lists , Policy , November's W3 news , Frequently Asked Questions .

What's out there?
Pointers to the world's online information, subjects , W3 servers, etc.
Help
on the browser you are using
Software Products
A list of W3 project ... ``` HTML CGI web CGI CGI Common Gateway Interface / webCGIwebURLCGICGI {% asset_img cgi.png CGI %} ```c /* * parse_uri - parse URI into filename and CGI args * return 0 if dynamic content, 1 if static */ /* $begin parse_uri */ int parse_uri(char *uri, char *filename, char *cgiargs) { char *ptr; if (!strstr(uri, "cgi-bin")) { /* Static content */ strcpy(cgiargs, ""); strcpy(filename, "."); strcat(filename, uri); if (uri[strlen(uri)-1] == '/') strcat(filename, "home.html"); return 1; } else { /* Dynamic content */ ptr = index(uri, '?'); if (ptr) { strcpy(cgiargs, ptr+1); *ptr = '\0'; } else { strcpy(cgiargs, ""); strcpy(filename, "."); strcat(filename, uri); return 0; } } /* $end parse_uri */ ``` URL Web CGIHTML C/C++ Perl PHP PHP Hypertext Preprocessor / Rasmus Lerdorf 1995 ```php

strpos() (FALSE)

Internet Explorer

The World Wide Web project

World Wide Web

The WorldWideWeb (W3) is a wide-area hypermedia information retrieval initiative aiming to give universal access to a large universe of documents.

Everything there is online about W3 is linked directly or indirectly to this document, including an executive summary of the project, Mailing lists , Policy , November's W3 news , Frequently Asked Questions .

What's out there?
Pointers to the world's online information, subjects , W3 servers, etc.
Help
on the browser you are using
Software Products
A list of W3 project ... ``` HTML CGI web CGI CGI Common Gateway Interface / webCGIwebURLCGICGI {% asset_img cgi.png CGI %} ```c /* * parse_uri - parse URI into filename and CGI args * return 0 if dynamic content, 1 if static */ /* $begin parse_uri */ int parse_uri(char *uri, char *filename, char *cgiargs) { char *ptr; if (!strstr(uri, "cgi-bin")) { /* Static content */ strcpy(cgiargs, ""); strcpy(filename, "."); strcat(filename, uri); if (uri[strlen(uri)-1] == '/') strcat(filename, "home.html"); return 1; } else { /* Dynamic content */ ptr = index(uri, '?'); if (ptr) { strcpy(cgiargs, ptr+1); *ptr = '\0'; } else { strcpy(cgiargs, ""); strcpy(filename, "."); strcat(filename, uri); return 0; } } /* $end parse_uri */ ``` URL Web CGIHTML C/C++ Perl PHP PHP Hypertext Preprocessor / Rasmus Lerdorf 1995 ```php

##  IE 11  FontIcon 

 IE11  .ttf/.woff   Network  `response headers`  `Pragmano-cache`, IE  WEB (Nginx..) `Pragmano-cache`  `Cache-Controlno-store` 

 [IE and Cache-Control](https://github.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/issues/6454)

## svg  IE 

svg  `chrome`  IE 

****

 `svg`  `style="width:100%;height:100%"`  `preserveAspectRatio="xMidYmin slice"` IE  SVG 
```
<svg version="1.1" id="_1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" x="0px" y="0px" width="100%" height="100%"
	 viewBox="-125 202 359.9 389" style="width: 100%;height: 100%;overflow:auto" xml:space="preserve"  preserveAspectRatio="xMidYMin slice">
```

## IE  svg text 
JavaScript  DOM  svg style  `document.querySelector('#selectorName').style.display='none'` 
 `document.querySelector('#selectorName').innerText='newText'`  `text` 

 IE`element.innerText`  `element.innerHTML` 

****

 `element.textContent`  `element.innerText` IE  JavaScript  `text` 

> `element.textContent` `innerText`  `innerHTML` [Node.textContent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/textContent)

javascript 

- 
>  [`esprima`](http://esprima.org/) A simple example on Node.js REPL:
```js
> var esprima = require('esprima');
> var program = 'const answer = 42';

> esprima.tokenize(program);
[ { type: 'Keyword', value: 'const' },
  { type: 'Identifier', value: 'answer' },
  { type: 'Punctuator', value: '=' },
  { type: 'Numeric', value: '42' } ]

> esprima.parse(program);
{ type: 'Program',
  body:
   [ { type: 'VariableDeclaration',
       declarations: [Object],
       kind: 'const' } ],
  sourceType: 'script' }
```

- 
-  javascript 
>  [`escodegen`](https://github.com/estools/escodegen) 
```js
// A simple example: the program

escodegen.generate({
    type: 'BinaryExpression',
    operator: '+',
    left: { type: 'Literal', value: 40 },
    right: { type: 'Literal', value: 2 }
});

// produces the string '40 + 2'.
```

Post.title: React
Post.content:
React , Controlled() onChange

Issues

, change React change value, change value render,

DOM events 3

  • compositionstart :
  • compositionupdate :
  • compositionend :

3 onChange onChange onChange state innerValue

3 form-lib

Warning: It looks like youre using a minified copy of the development build of React. When deploying React apps to production, make sure to use the production build which skips development warnings and is faster.

React v15.* minified

React webpack webpack webpack-dev-server webpack

Make your own React production version with webpack

setState(): Can only update a mounted or mounting component. This usually means you called setState() on an unmounted component. This is a no-op.

setState setState setState

setState setState ES6 this.isMounted()

ES6 isMounted is an Antipattern

isMounted componentDidMount isMounted true,
componentWillUnmount isMounted false isMounted

Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique key prop.

key

lists and keys

index key ID
Index as a key is an anti-pattern

IE 11 Objects are not valid as a React child

: error-decoder

React 15.4 react-hot-loader babel-polyfill, webpack.config.js :

IE 11 Minified exception occurred; use the non-minified dev environment for the full error message and additional helpful warnings.
